gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗ ਗੰਗ ਮਿਲਿ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਗੁਰ ਸਾਗਰ ਮਿਲੇ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਪਰਮ ਨਿਧਾਨ ਲਿਵ ਲੀਨ ਹੈ
transliteration: Saadhasang Gang Mili Sree Gur Saagar Milay , Giaan Dhiaan Param Nidhaan Liv Leen Hai ?
translation: A Sikh ever in attendance of Satguru merges in the ocean-like True Guru through the Ganges-like holy congregation. He remains engrossed in the fountain-head of Cyan (knowledge) and contemplation.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਨ ਕਮਲ ਮਕਰੰਦ ਮਧੁਕਰ ਗਤਿ ਚੰਦ੍ਰਮਾ ਚਕੋਰ ਗੁਰ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਰਸ ਭੀਨ ਹੈ
transliteration: Charan Kamal Makarand Madhoukar Gati , Chandramaa Chakor Gur Dhiaan Ras Bheen Hai ?
translation: A True Sikh remains absorbed and immersed in the holy dust of the True Guru like a bumble bee and longs for a glimpse of his Guru just as a moon bird experiences pangs of separation of his beloved moon.

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਮੁਕਤਾਹਲ ਅਹਾਰ ਹੰਸ ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਪਰਮਾਰਥ ਬਿਮਲ ਜਲ ਮੀਨ ਹੈ
transliteration: Sabad Surati Moukataahal Ahaar Hansa , Praym Paramaarad Bimal Jal Meen Hai ?
translation: Like a swan whose diet is pearls, a true Sikh relishes the pearl-like Naam as his life support. Like a fish, he swims in the cool, clean and comforting waters of spirituality.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਕਟਾਛ ਅਮਰਾਪਦ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾਲ ਕਮਲਾ ਕਲਪਤਰ ਕਾਮਧੇਨਾਧੀਨ ਹੈ ॥੯੭॥
transliteration: Anmrit Kataachh Amaraapad Kripaa Kripaala , Kamalaa Kalapatar Kaamadhaynaadheen Hai ?97?
translation: By the element and nectar-like glimpse of grace of the True Guru, a true Sikh attains immortality. And then all mythical donors like Kamdhen cow or Kalap brichh and even Lakshmi (Goddess of wealth) serve him diligently. (97)
